snippet: A Federal District Court jury here ruled today that six big oil companies must pay the Unocal Corporation at least $68 million for infringement of a patent on clean-burning gasoline that is sold in California.    The decision could also lead to fu...
lead_paragraph: A Federal District Court jury here ruled today that six big oil companies must pay the Unocal Corporation at least $68 million for infringement of a patent on clean-burning gasoline that is sold in California. The decision could also lead to future royalties of tens of millions of dollars a year for Unocal, although that is far from assured.
abstract: Federal District Court jury rules that six big oil companies must pay Unocal Corp at least $68 million for infringement of patent on clean-burning gasoline that is sold in California; decision could also lead to future royalties of tens of millions of dollars a year for Unocal; six companies are ARCO, Chevron, Exxon, Mobil, Shell Oil and Texaco (M)

headline.main: Jury Tells Six Competitors to Pay Unocal
